item.title: ARC Raiders Event Tracker—Every Map Condition Schedule
item.content:encoded:
Map Conditions are a crucial aspect of ARC Raiders, as each one can shift how you engage with your next raid. Some might encourage you to fight an elite ARC enemy, like the Queen or Matriarch, whilst others lock off certain POIs until you open them.

It’s not just for fun, though, as some Conditions can offer better—or sometimes exclusive—loot. However, you can’t jump into these various Map Conditions whenever you’d like, as they’re on a strict schedule, meaning you’ll need to plan your raids accordingly.

If you’re looking to play a specific Map Condition in ARC Raiders, then look no further, as Insider Gaming has all of the timings for each one listed below.

All ARC Raiders Map Conditions

There are currently 10 Map Conditions in rotation for ARC Raiders, and these are split into two categories: Minor and Major Map Conditions.

Each Map Condition has its own unique gimmicks that change up gameplay, and Embark Studios is regularly adding new ones or altering pre-existing ones. Additionally, some are exclusive to certain maps, as they’re dependent on the setting; for example, Bird City is exclusive to Buried City, meaning you’ll only find the rare Rubber Ducks when that Minor Map Condition is in rotation.

Here’s the list of every ARC Raiders Minor Map Condition currently in rotation:

  • Uncovered Caches
  • Husk Graveyard
  • Matriarch
  • Launch Tower Loot
  • Harvester
  • Bird City

Here’s the list of every ARC Raiders Major Map Condition currently in rotation:

  • Night Raid
  • Electromagnetic Storm
  • Hidden Bunker
  • Locked Gate

Every Map Event Schedule In ARC Raiders

The ARC Raiders Map Conditions run on a regular schedule, with each map rotating every hour.

Every Map Condition runs for an hour at a time, and once the timer’s up, a new Event will take its place. However, not every map has an Event always running, and there are often downtime periods. It encourages experiencing different maps and working with different strategies, but you’ll need to plan ahead if you’re hoping to play during a specific one.

With that in mind, here’s the official ARC Raiders Map Condition Schedule:

The schedule is prone to changes, so be sure to check back often to see if the rotation has altered in any way.

item.title: ARC Raiders Events Return After Blip Removes Them From The Game
item.content:encoded:
Last night, ARC Raiders players were busying themselves with querying the disappearance of events in ARC Raiders. In social circles worldwide, fans of the extraction adventure were asking why there were no ARC Raiders events live, given that they’re a persistent feature that rotate non-stop, keeping things fresh for players.

In a post on the game’s Discord server, it was confirmed that an ‘issue with the map conditions schedule’ has been resolved and that events are back in rotation.

ARC Raiders Events Are Back, and Bird City Has Changed

In a post on the ARC Raiders Discord server, the community team confirmed:

Last night there was an issue with the map conditions schedule. We just pushed an update enabling this week’s schedule while also increasing the frequency of Bird City. No download required, but please restart your game to update. We will keep revising and try to find a schedule for all conditions so that all time zones get a chance to play.

There is no store rotation or patch this week, but keep an eye out for the update coming next week.

That statement refers to the disappointment from fans regarding the rotation for Bird City, a minor map condition introduced in the most recent update. It had an awkward schedule, prompting some to stress that ‘those with jobs’ couldn’t access it.

For several hours last night, ARC Raiders events disappeared from the game, leaving a blank map palette that offered no special conditions under which to explore Embark Studios’ extraction title. That meant no Harvester, no Hidden Bunker, and no Electromagnetic Storm, amongst other things.

Fans began to panic, thinking it was an indication of something awful happening at Embark Studios, but it was little more than a momentary blip that was rectified by the team.

Were you worried about the disappearance of ARC Raiders events? Let us know which one you missed the most during the outage on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Is High on Life 2 on Xbox Game Pass?
item.content:encoded:
A new foul-mouthed shooter is on the horizon with the release of High on Life 2, and, like with any release, there is discussions about whether the game is available on Xbox Game Pass.

The action-adventure shooter from Squanch Games releases on PlayStation 5, PC, and Xbox Series X|S on February 13, with a Nintendo Switch 2 launch later down the line.

If you’re an Xbox player and want to know if High on Life 2 is included with your Game Pass subscription, Insider Gaming has all the details.

Is High on Life 2 on Xbox Game Pass?

Yes, High on Life 2 is included with an Xbox Game Pass subscription and will be playable on day one when it launches on February 13.

The approach is not a surprise, as a similar launch was taken with the original game, and means those with a subscription to Game Pass won’t have to splash out to purchase High on Life 2 outright.

However, following changes made to the Game Pass service last year, the availability of High on Life 2 depends on which tier of subscription you are signed up to.

What Game Pass Subscription Tier is Needed For High on Life 2?

A Game Pass Ultimate subscription is required to jump into High on Life 2 on Xbox Series X|S or PC without purchasing the game separately.

The Ultimate subscription is the only way to obtain day one releases on Xbox Game Pass following Microsoft’s changes in 2025, though the Game Pass Premium tier adds new games within 12 months of their launch.

Neither the standard PC Game Pass nor Xbox Game Pass Essentials provides access to High on Life 2, so Ultimate is the only choice if you want to play immediately at launch.

What Edition of High on Life 2 is Included With Xbox Game Pass?

An Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscription provides access to the Standard Edition of High on Life 2, with no advertised bonuses.

High on Life 2 does have a pre-order bundle available, providing the ‘I PRE-ORDERED HIGH ON LIFE 2’ hat for select weapons, and, while it provides no benefits, Squanch Games says “if you don’t pre-order, you’ll never be allowed to have it.”

As this is merely a cosmetic bonus, there isn’t much need to splash out, unless you really want to, and the Standard Edition that comes with a Game Pass subscription is sufficient.

item.title: Sony Wants To Use Gen-AI To Feed You Fake Podcasts Voiced by PlayStation Characters
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever sat there and wondered how cool it would be to listen to a fake podcast presented by God of War’s Kratos or Ellie from The Last of Us? No? Well, you’re probably not alone. But for some reason, Sony thinks that’s exactly what people want, as a recently discovered patent reveals that the tech titan plans to use generative AI to facilitate such a concept.

In an uncovered filing, the ‘LLM-Based Generative Podcasts for Gamers’ proposal was unearthed, and it would use generative AI to create personalized podcasts voiced by some of PlayStation’s most iconic characters.

Who Wants To Listen to AI-Delivered Podcasts?

Sony’s latest patent publication aims to use a gamer’s personal profile to piece together an AI-driven podcast feed hosted by their favorite first-party characters. That means you could have Ghost of Tsushima’s Jin Sakai’s dulcet tones in your ear, moulded by AI, giving you the lowdown on gaming news that might interest you.

The background of the patent, submitted in 2024 but only just published on the WIPO platform, explains:

As recognized herein, video game platforms currently lack the ability to provide unique and targeted content to gamers to update the gamers about things that are happening on the platform. There are currently no adequate solutions to the foregoing computer-related, technological problem.

(Thanks to Tech4Gamers for the spot)

The lengthy summary of the proposed patent goes on to detail using an LLM (Large Language Model) to identify data associated with your PlayStation profile and then generate a podcast of news related to that data.

It would then be reeled off by a video game character of a game played by the video game player.

This could then be paired with video footage, trailers, screenshots, and other media.

But it would get pretty personal. The filing revealed how ‘the audio may include a joke at the video game player’s expense.’ Which means you could be roasted by a generative-AI podcast voiced by your favorite characters. Because that’s what we, as gamers, want.

The patent filing came with images that showed how this would fit on your PlayStation dashboard:

Another image showed how a video podcast using this same format would work, using ‘desk hosts’ to give players something visual to focus on:

At no point in the filing does it indicate how the voice actors for these characters would potentially be compensated or represented via this technology. It could be a nightmare for the actors who brought these characters to life, as while it’s their voices that are being used ad infinitum, the characters and their personas are owned by PlayStation and the vast number of studios under that banner.

Do you think there are any major concerns regarding this patent, and would you want to listen to gen-AI podcasts featuring your favorite characters? Let us know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Reanimal Release Date Countdown, Exact Start Times & All Platforms
item.content:encoded:
A terrifying new experience lies around the corner with the highly-anticipated release of Reanimal, which is set to make a splash upon its release date.

Coming from the developers of Little Nightmares 2, Reanimal offers a co-op horror adventure through a disturbing world, and expectations are high for the Tarsier Studios title.

For all the release date details, the exact start time you can jump in and play, and all the platforms Reanimal is available on, Insider Gaming has you covered.

What is The Reanimal Release Date?

Reanimal’s official release date is Friday, February 13, though the date may change depending on where you are located in the world.

THQ Nordic has adopted a global release structure for Reanimal, meaning the game becomes available to all players around the world simultaneously. In some regions, this means Reanimal will actually be released on February 14.

Reanimal Start Times

Reanimal releases at 6 AM PT on February 13, and the global release means simultaneous access for all players across the world.

While this approach is familiar to PC players, it may be a different experience for those on console, where many releases adopt a staggered release. When a staggered release is available, it opens the door for some ways to access games early. However, this isn’t the case for Reanimal.

All the start times for Reanimal in major regions across the world are shown in the table below. Confirmation of the start times comes via the PlayStation Store and SteamDB.

All Reanimal Platforms

Reanimal is available across multiple platforms on its launch date, with Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, PC, and Nintendo Switch 2, allowing all players to jump in.

There is no release on last-gen consoles, however, so those on Xbox One, PlayStation 4, and the original Nintendo Switch will have to miss out.

Physical editions are also available immediately at launch, including a Collector’s Edition, and future DLC content is planned.
